Package substrings

Interface Finder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FindingsAK
    public interface Finder
    Find occurs of pattern string in the text. It must be dynamic. So finding algorithm should work character by character. It allows to not save text in memory (RAM).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> findPatternInText​(java.io.File file)
      Find all pattern occurrences in specify file.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> findPatternInText​(java.lang.String string)
      Find all pattern occurrences in specify string.
      java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getAnswer()
      Return arrayList with position of pattern occurrences in the text.
      void nextChar​(char symbol)
      Get next symbol, analyze this, changes the internal state of finder.
      void setPattern​(java.lang.String pattern)
      Clear previous state of support structures.

    • Method Detail

      • findPatternInText

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> findPatternInText​(java.lang.String string)
        Find all pattern occurrences in specify string.
        Parameters:
        string - the string in which patterns occurrences will be searched
        Returns:
        arrayList with positions of pattern in file.

      • findPatternInText

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> findPatternInText​(java.io.File file)
                                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Find all pattern occurrences in specify file.
        Parameters:
        file - the file in which patterns occurrences will be searched
        Returns:
        arrayList with positions of pattern in file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - if there is no file
        java.io.IOException

      • setPattern

        void setPattern​(java.lang.String pattern)
        Clear previous state of support structures. Set pattern into this finder, set some parameters and support things in specify way.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the string, occurrences of which will be searched in the text.

      • nextChar

        void nextChar​(char symbol)
        Get next symbol, analyze this, changes the internal state of finder. If there is occurrences of pattern in text, then position of this will be saved in the answerArray. This function is used for others algorithm, and user can use this for other text representation (pipes, sockets, buffer and etc).
        Parameters:
        symbol - next symbol in the text.

      • getAnswer

        java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> getAnswer()
        Return arrayList with position of pattern occurrences in the text.
        Returns:
        arrayList with position of pattern occurrences in the text.
